intro: Psychotria isarogensis, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with white markings, which are often surrounded by dark green, velvety leaves. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing along stream banks or in rocky areas. Psychotria isarogensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
